HPI 8293 Lancia Delta Integrale 16V 1989 Rallye Sanremo – Rallye d'Italia Winner M. Biasion/T. Siviero (night version)

Purchased: 2015
Manufacturer Page: http://www.hpimodelcar.com/line_up/pop/8293/8293.html

14th WRC win for Miki Biasion.
54th WRC win for Lancia. Lancia had the record for most WRC event wins at this time with 30 more than their nearest rival - Audi.
First WRC win for Lancia Delta Integrale 16V.

(from Lancia Delta Group A | Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia)

The Integrale 16V made its debut on the 1989 Rallye Sanremo where, for the first and only time, it ran in Italian racing red. Didier Auriol went out early in the event after a high-speed crash, but Biasion went on to win. Having won both the manufacturers’ and drivers’ titles for the third year running, Lancia declined to contest the final round of the season, the RAC Rally.

HPI made two versions of this car. The one seen here and the daytime version.
